subject: Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-26 13:17:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/conf/agent/common.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/use_random_fully-527b20bc524c308a.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fa77abbc153dcf040a95f6a001d6661e07c25096', 'message': 'Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
(cherry picked from commit bbefe5285e7ab799422fab81488f57c9c22769b6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/95/854795/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Add ``use_random_fully`` setting to allow an operator to disable the iptables random-fully property on an iptable rules. issues: - | If the ``use_random_fully`` setting is disabled, it will prevent random fully from being used and if there're 2 guests in different networks using the same source_ip and source_port and they try to reach the same dest_ip and dest_port, packets might be dropped in the kernel do to the racy tuple generation . Disabling this setting should only be done if source_port is really important such as in network firewall ACLs and that the source_ip are never repeating within the platform.

subject: Update ovmf-amdsev from ovmf-cc to boot UEFI VMs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-24 13:37:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/83f6dd5a97cf00eaf7dd8f65dc053bce704b2fa9', 'message': "Update ovmf-amdsev from ovmf-cc to boot UEFI VMs

Fix for a package was expected in edk2-20220526git16779ede2d36-2.el9,
but it's not there yet.

Without this fix, Nova cannot boot UEFI instances for AMD arch becase
there is no nvram-template data in
/usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-amdsev.json.

Symlinking it from /usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-cc.json would be
quick and dirty w/a but it's better to merge the nvram-template into
it. This way other amd-specific feautes would be preserved.

Provide that merging data w/a for nova virtqemud containers build
scripts, until it is fixed in centos-stream9 and rhel9 packaging.

presense.

Symlinking it from /usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-cc.json would be

commit_message:
Update ovmf-amdsev from ovmf-cc to boot UEFI VMs

Fix for a package was expected in edk2-20220526git16779ede2d36-2.el9,
but it's not there yet.

Without this fix, Nova cannot boot UEFI instances for x86_64 arch because
there is no nvram-template data in
/usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-amdsev.json.

Symlinking it from /usr/share/qemu/firmware/edk2-ovmf-cc.json would be
quick and dirty w/a but it's better to merge the nvram-template into
it. This way other amdsev-specific feautes would be preserved.

Provide that merging data w/a for nova virtqemud containers build
scripts, until it is fixed in centos-stream9 and rhel9 packaging.

Nova compute also reads those ovmf files, so apply the w/a to
nova compute TCIB as well. It is not clear where from these files
come into nova compute container (edk2-ovmf is only installed in
the libvirt virtqemud container, and no packages require it in
RDO), so for safety reasons, add a quarding check for the source file
presense.

Change-Id: Ieaacb67d16e82e9c34fcfb31398da5a95cdc3d43
Related: rhbz#2090752
Related: rhbz#2109644
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/14/854414/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - run: jq ".mapping[\"nvram-template\"] = $(jq ".mapping[\"nvram-template\"]" /usr/share/qemu/firmware/50-edk2-ovmf-cc.json)" /usr/share/qemu/firmware/50-edk2-ovmf-amdsev.json > /tmp/50-edk2-ovmf-amdsev_.json && mv -f /tmp/50-edk2-ovmf-amdsev_.json /usr/share/qemu/firmware/50-edk2-ovmf-amdsev_.json

commit_message:
Update NDP proxy documentation

- Use only the documentation prefix in examples
- Update some formatting and wording
- Add a reference in the OVN gaps document

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: I2acf762008ce44b6a792c615c153071e1c10e0b3

commit_message:
Update volume and volume transfer schema

Fix the volume transfers client so that it supports microversions,
by deriving from the volume service's base client.

Define volume transfer schema for mv 3.55 and 3.57, and
volume schema for mv 3.65 and 3.69.

Change-Id: I4ad7fe336c5193604d95fca5a72695d82adaa9f0

commit_message:
Attach and detach an SR-IOV port

Adds test support for attaching/detaching SR-IOV ports to guests. [1]
These tests pull from the original tempest format [2] from
AttachInterfacesTestJSON.test_reassign_port_between_servers. It adds
additional checks around the guest XML as well as checking within the
guest for the SR-IOV vendor/device id.

Commit also moves _get_pci_addr_from_device from vgpu to hardware.py to
allow it to be called from different tests beyond vgpu.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1685152
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/compute/servers/test_attach_interfaces.py#L295

Change-Id: I340fd6486b0a179830e6e559281adc257fefb4bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin refs/changes/82/845382/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import timefrom tempest.common.utils.linux import remote_client from tempest.common import waitersfrom tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc class SRIOVAttachAndDetach(SRIOVBase): # Test utilizes the optional host parameter for server creation introduced # in 2.74 to schedule the guest to a specific compute host. This allows the # test to dictate specific target hosts as the test progresses. min_microversion = '2.74' def setUp(self): super(SRIOVAttachAndDetach, self).setUp() self.sriov_network = self._create_sriov_net() self._create_sriov_subnet(self.sriov_network['network']['id']) @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): cls.prepare_instance_network() super(SRIOVAttachAndDetach, cls).setup_credentials() def wait_for_port_detach(self, port_id): """Waits for the port's device_id to be unset. :param port_id: The id of the port being detached. :returns: The final port dict from the show_port response. """ port = self.os_primary.ports_client.show_port(port_id)['port'] device_id = port['device_id'] start = int(time.time()) # NOTE(mriedem): Nova updates the port's device_id to '' rather than # None, but it's not contractual so handle Falsey either way. while device_id: time.sleep(self.build_interval) port = self.os_primary.ports_client.show_port(port_id)['port'] device_id = port['device_id'] timed_out = int(time.time()) - start >= self.build_timeout if device_id and timed_out: message = ('Port %s failed to detach (device_id %s) within ' 'the required time (%s s).' % (port_id, device_id, self.build_timeout)) raise lib_exc.TimeoutException(message) return port def _check_vendor_id(self, linux_client): cmd = 'cat /sys/bus/pci/devices/*/vendor' sys_out = linux_client.exec_command(cmd) return sys_out # cat /sys/bus/pci/devices/0000\:08\:0e.1/vendor # cat /sys/bus/pci/devices/0000\:08\:0e.1/device # [8086:154c] def _create_ssh_client(self, server, validation_resources): """Create an ssh client to execute commands on the guest instance :param server: the ssh client will be setup to interface with the provided server instance :param valdiation_resources: necessary validation information to setup an ssh session :return linux_client: the ssh client that allows for guest command execution """ linux_client = remote_client.RemoteClient( self.get_server_ip(server, validation_resources), self.image_ssh_user, self.image_ssh_password, validation_resources['keypair']['private_key'], server=server, servers_client=self.servers_client) linux_client.validate_authentication() return linux_client def create_validateable_instance(self): """Create a validateable instance based on provided flavor :param flavor: dict, attributes describing flavor :param validation_resources: dict, parameters necessary to setup ssh client and validate the guest """ validation_resources = self.get_test_validation_resources( self.os_primary) server = self.create_test_server( validatable=True, validation_resources=validation_resources, wait_until='ACTIVE') linux_client = self._create_ssh_client(server, validation_resources) return (server, linux_client) def _check_interface(self, iface, server_id=None, port_id=None, network_id=None, fixed_ip=None, mac_addr=None): if server_id: iface = waiters.wait_for_interface_status( self.interfaces_client, server_id, iface['port_id'], 'ACTIVE') if port_id: self.assertEqual(iface['port_id'], port_id) if network_id: self.assertEqual(iface['net_id'], network_id) if fixed_ip: self.assertEqual(iface['fixed_ips'][0]['ip_address'], fixed_ip) if mac_addr: self.assertEqual(iface['mac_addr'], mac_addr) def test_attach_and_detach_sriov_port(self): net_vlan = \ CONF.network_feature_enabled.provider_net_base_segmentation_id servers = [self.create_validateable_instance(), self.create_validateable_instance()] port = self._create_sriov_port( net=self.sriov_network, vnic_type=CONF.network.port_vnic_type ) port_id = port['port']['id'] for server, linux_client in servers: iface = self.interfaces_client.create_interface( server['id'], port_id=port_id)['interfaceAttachment'] interface_xml_element = self._get_xml_interface_device( server['id'], port['port']['id'] ) self._check_interface(iface, server['id'], port_id) self._validate_port_xml_vlan_tag(interface_xml_element, net_vlan) self._check_vendor_id(linux_client) self.interfaces_client.delete_interface(server['id'], port_id) self.wait_for_port_detach(port_id)

commit_message:
Exclude .cache when running flake8

For local runs of testenv:linters we cache all the external Ansible
playbooks and roles ansible-lint will need to reference in order to
validate content in this repository. We build that cache in a .cache
directory, but not everything in the cached repositories is suitable
for flake8 checking, so add that directory to its exclusion list.

Also add the same directory to .gitignore, so Git will stop
complaining about it being untracked.

Change-Id: I1f740edd75cc7f6ba0f4a73f0a409a620b437b16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/42/854842/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove 'glance-download' from default import methods

As 'glance-download' requires federated deployments it should
not be enabled by default.

Added line explaining it being available for such deployments
in the config help text.

Change-Id: Icc792e23aad9e7a9a788e6b5826bc5aae54ae978

commit_message:
Optimize ShardRanges a little

We make a lot of ShardRange objects, pretty much all the time.  Try to
make it a little better:

  * Add __slots__ to improve memory consumption and attribute lookups.
  * Avoid the overhead of catch_warnings() by not tripping the warning.

Change-Id: Ib1c698be9e9f579649bc81acf3562c92feb6c8d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/02/851602/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: __slots__ = ( 'account', 'container', '_timestamp', '_meta_timestamp', '_state_timestamp', '_epoch', '_lower', '_upper', '_deleted', '_state', '_count', '_bytes', '_tombstones', '_reported') if value is None or (value == b"" if isinstance(value, bytes) else value == u""): value = ShardRange.MIN if value is None or (value == b"" if isinstance(value, bytes) else value == u""): value = ShardRange.MAX
deleted_lines: with warnings.catch_warnings(): warnings.simplefilter('ignore', UnicodeWarning) if value in (None, b'', u''): value = ShardRange.MIN with warnings.catch_warnings(): warnings.simplefilter('ignore', UnicodeWarning) if value in (None, b'', u''): value = ShardRange.MAX

commit_message:
Capture requests errors

Situations can occur where rare exceptions can originate
from within python requests, which are not captured or handled
in Sushy.

Example: Encoding errors should trigger some sort of recovery,
but cached session clients cannot recover, and power synchronization
for users, such as Ironic, break on the cached session when they
attempt to access them for the same task, again.

Change-Id: I0f79083d41b0b7ccf7e4dbfc81fd1d42c2e5eb15
(cherry picked from commit b855365ef0aa77924ec7a39952bc3ebdd1922f97)
(cherry picked from commit 1ae8e49d4f63efb13ae75aff5a7d0969de92f02f)

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>

subject: Do not send compression as acceptable encoding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-25 15:34:50.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/do-not-offer-compression-encoding-884ca8a7458cb096.yaml', 'sushy/connector.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sushy/commit/8007b11e0ca6203f699d3f9a297f970f3369a644', 'message': 'Do not send compression as acceptable encoding

When a BMC can compress a response, the internal server... or any
intermediate proxy may change a "Strong" ETag to a "Weak" ETag, as
the strength of the ETag represents the byte-by-byte consistency of the
response body.

Compressed responses may differ slightly, especially if different encoding
is used or negotiated. This is problematic when a resource expects a
follow-up request or action to contain a "Strong" ETag as it is the client
certifying it understood the prior precise state.

We no longer request opportunistic response encoding, and expressly request
responses are not modified or compressed by the intermediate server, which
should have a minimal impact to use and provide a higher level of BMC
interaction consistency.

Change-Id: Idb2d6bee96bd23cfc4fb8f014661231766998781
(cherry picked from commit 51dacf272f4d0f3e346c69e94786da2b7ee7c935)
(cherry picked from commit 021e0175e2ffc7c31e7052fb3bc39c9e28b83783)
(cherry picked from commit cff4cc1cbe9f2196dccc5c6ee990b2cc66a9f3a4)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not send compression as acceptable encoding

When a BMC can compress a response, the internal server... or any
intermediate proxy may change a "Strong" ETag to a "Weak" ETag, as
the strength of the ETag represents the byte-by-byte consistency of the
response body.

Compressed responses may differ slightly, especially if different encoding
is used or negotiated. This is problematic when a resource expects a
follow-up request or action to contain a "Strong" ETag as it is the client
certifying it understood the prior precise state.

We no longer request opportunistic response encoding, and expressly request
responses are not modified or compressed by the intermediate server, which
should have a minimal impact to use and provide a higher level of BMC
interaction consistency.

Change-Id: Idb2d6bee96bd23cfc4fb8f014661231766998781
(cherry picked from commit 51dacf272f4d0f3e346c69e94786da2b7ee7c935)
(cherry picked from commit 021e0175e2ffc7c31e7052fb3bc39c9e28b83783)
(cherry picked from commit cff4cc1cbe9f2196dccc5c6ee990b2cc66a9f3a4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sushy refs/changes/41/854641/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(TheJulia): Depending on the BMC, offering compression as an # acceptable response changes the ETag behavior to offering an # automatic "weak" ETag response, which is appropriate because the # body content *may* not be a byte for byte match given compression. # Overall, the value of compression is less than the value of concise # interaction with the BMC. Setting to identity basically means # "without modification or compression". By default, python-requests # indicates responses can be compressed. self._session.headers['Accept-Encoding'] = 'identity'

commit_message:
Distinguish between port number of internal endpoint and binding
port number in cinder

Now binding ports of service and pod spec are configured using
internal endpoint values.
To support reverse proxy for internalUrl, need to distinguish
between binding ports and internal endpoint ports.

I added `service` section in endpoint items apart from admin,public
,internal and default.

Change-Id: I40c3fc822e8ea9ef0eca8c15afe0d12b8bc926ff

commit_message:
Ensure members without subnet belong to VIP subnet or fail

This patch ensures the members without subnet are only accepted
if the IP of the member belongs to the CIDR of the VIP subnet,
as that is the subnet associated to the loadbalancer used to
obtain the subnet for the members that do not have it.

Closes-Bug: #1982111

(manually cherry picked from commit 136b829579e83618b8497963153edff1de320e6b)

Change-Id: I0fd90c9329a2ec43823813542f263845562c45f2
(cherry picked from commit 136b829579e83618b8497963153edff1de320e6b)

commit_message:
Remove re-try for object creation

object storage create does not require retry due to conflict
The right approach is waiter when needed.

Change-Id: I559172391c5577b311743b3b8ea20a883087b2bc

subject: Fix software raid output poisoning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-25 15:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-softraid-name-poisoning-4e934dd4e60830b1.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_hardware.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/samples/hardware_samples.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/6660e01e1f8a6e7a40b798eea5215b1eddcbe0c3', 'message': 'Fix software raid output poisoning

In the event a device name is set to contain a raid device path,
it is possible for the Name and Events field values of mdadm's
detailed output to contain text which inadvertently gets captured and
mapped as component data for the "holder" devices of the RAID set.

This would cause invalid values to get passed to UEFI methods
which would cause a deployment to fail under these circumstances.

We now ignore the Name and Events fields in mdadm output.

Change-Id: If721dfe1caa5915326482969e55fbf4697538231
(cherry picked from commit f3e3de8097f05cc830768da7d3f3e9eae04b40a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix software raid output poisoning

In the event a device name is set to contain a raid device path,
it is possible for the Name and Events field values of mdadm's
detailed output to contain text which inadvertently gets captured and
mapped as component data for the "holder" devices of the RAID set.

This would cause invalid values to get passed to UEFI methods
which would cause a deployment to fail under these circumstances.

We now ignore the Name and Events fields in mdadm output.

Change-Id: If721dfe1caa5915326482969e55fbf4697538231
(cherry picked from commit f3e3de8097f05cc830768da7d3f3e9eae04b40a1)

commit_message:
Replace tenant-usage with project-usage

In nova we replaces tenant* with project*.
This patch mainly replaces tenant-* to proejct-* for
'os-simple-tenant-usage' api, and releated APIs

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/764292

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

commit_message:
Fix test_get_console_output_server_id_in_shutoff_status

the test was not actually testing what it was meant to:

it creates its own server (not re-using the class-level one),
shuts it off, and waits for _get_output passing -
which in turn is hardcoded to use the server id of the class-level
server.
Thus the test was not actually getting the console output
of the server it has just created and shut off, but the class-level one.

To fix this _get_output now accepts optional argument with server id
to check on.

Change-Id: I0f0e48d7e11d2f2f420d106ac8d062c0c56911af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/06/710206/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functools def _get_output(self, server_id=None): server_id or self.server_id, length=3)['output'] self.wait_for(functools.partial(self._get_output, temp_server_id))

commit_message:
set PATH to find pip installed tox

We need to be able to find a tox installed with pip, but we don't pick
up /etc/profile where /usr/local/bin is commonly added when running this
in CI. See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/735640/ for where this was
found to be needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/739942/
Change-Id: I1e4c9f05c77f2fa64fc962e5e5216a84f29faf52
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/78/739778/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Set PATH # we need to be able to find a tox installed with pip, but we don't pick up /etc/profile when running this in CI set_fact: tempest_tox_environmanet: "{{ tempest_tox_environment | combine({'PATH': ansible_env.PATH+':/usr/local/bin'}) }}"

subject: Add import line unit tests for check_uuid command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-07-30 20:34:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/e9c4e5e41508b9a93bd01524ae7a76f053ae28c3', 'message': 'Add import line unit tests for check_uuid command

check_uuid end up adding the import line at the end of the
file if there is no tempest import present in the file.

This is due to:
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/f2727fa6b4eb9ed3a8b48f6b8a6b0d34d72307fb/tempest/lib/cmd/check_uuid.py#L186-L191
where line_no is passed as 0 to add_patch.

0 line number is never a valid value for add_patch and end
up adding the import line at the end of file.

This commit adds test to cover this case.

Change-Id: I35fe49a6ce2148890c55f279cf8742c0e4332004

commit_message:
Add import line unit tests for check_uuid command

check_uuid end up adding the import line at the end of the
file if there is no tempest import present in the file.

This is due to:
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/f2727fa6b4eb9ed3a8b48f6b8a6b0d34d72307fb/tempest/lib/cmd/check_uuid.py#L186-L191
where line_no is passed as 0 to add_patch.

0 line number is never a valid value for add_patch and end
up adding the import line at the end of file.

This commit adds test to cover the expected line number case where
decorator import will be patched in both cases 1. if there is no
tempest import 2. there is tempest import.

Change-Id: I35fe49a6ce2148890c55f279cf8742c0e4332004
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/48/744048/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _assert_import_line_number(self, patcher, expected_line_no): def fake_add_patch(source_path, import_snippet, line_no): self.assertEqual(expected_line_no, line_no) return old_add_patch(source_path, import_snippet, line_no) old_add_patch = patcher.add_patch patcher.add_patch = mock.Mock(side_effect=fake_add_patch) self._assert_import_line_number(patcher, 1) self._assert_import_line_number(patcher, 3)

commit_message:
Remove hard code cidr in test_create_server_multi_nic.

Now, We have some hard code in here, but some VPC are limited to
some specific address ranges by default in some cloud.

So, we need change these hard code to configuration, it can
meet the user specific requirement flexibly and reasonably.

Change-Id: I69c3ac73bda0cc1f0040989c418811cac5254d6a
closes-bug: #1743742

commit_message:
Update skip check for ServersTestBootFromVolume

Introduce new config option boot_from_volume in compute-feature-enabled
group which specifies if booting from volume is allowed.

Change-Id: Ieaed751b55bdfd38750ab3dd659e437eca937a0a

commit_message:
Fallback to certifi-certs if ca_certs is not given

added workaround for issues with some plugins f.e. octavia/murano
which dont set ca_certs during init.

Since CERT_REQ is the new default in urllib3, this leads to connection
failures caused by client being unable to verify certs.

Closes-Bug: 1872314
Change-Id: Ib7ebb2848a854dddd081666b472916df0998791b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/30/720130/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import certififrom oslo_log import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) if ca_certs: kwargs['ca_certs'] = ca_certs else: LOG.warn("No ca_certs given - using certifi for default: %s" % certifi.where()) kwargs['ca_certs'] = certifi.where() if ca_certs: else: LOG.warn("No ca_certs given - using certifi for default: %s" % certifi.where()) kwargs['ca_certs'] = certifi.where()

commit_message:
[WIP] Add scenario of retyping in-use encrypted volume

This is to add test to retype volumes to different encryption.

Later more changes will be done to make the jeckins passed in Mitaka
release.

Change-Id: I2c507e82c95aa1f00ddbb69684250931bace82a2
Depends-On: I1265cc2af2acb1d950c7a944e607a9707d2f69e6
Depneds-On: I5555641804619e21eaa7d45db8d951884fc17de7

added_lines: from tempest.common import waiters def create_encrypted_volume_type(self, encryption_provider, volume_type): return volume_type def create_encrypted_volume(self, encryption_provider, volume_type): volume_type = self.create_encrypted_volume_type( encryption_provider, volume_type) @test.idempotent_id('8cb6aabb-1297-4bd8-9cf0-de0fcb0a5ef4') @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'image') def test_retype_inuse_encrypted_cinder_volumes(self): new_type = self.create_encrypted_volume_type( 'nova.volume.encryptors.' 'cryptsetup.CryptsetupEncryptor', volume_type='cryptsetup') volume = self.create_encrypted_volume('nova.volume.encryptors.' 'luks.LuksEncryptor', volume_type='luks') server = self.launch_instance() attached_volume = self.nova_volume_attach(server, volume) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'in-use') self.volumes_client.retype_volume( volume['id'], new_type=new_type['id'], migration_policy='on-demand') waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'in-use') volume_dest = ( self.volumes_client.show_volume(volume['id'])['volume']) self.assertEqual(new_type['name'], volume_dest['volume_type']) self.nova_volume_detach(server, attached_volume) @test.idempotent_id('d295a263-0cae-4f5c-9907-2c94207327b5') @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'image') def test_retype_inuse_encrypted_cinder_volumes_to_unencrypted(self): new_type = self.create_volume_type(name='unencrypted') volume = self.create_encrypted_volume('nova.volume.encryptors.' 'luks.LuksEncryptor', volume_type='luks') server = self.launch_instance() attached_volume = self.nova_volume_attach(server, volume) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'in-use') self.volumes_client.retype_volume( volume['id'], new_type=new_type['id'], migration_policy='on-demand') waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'in-use') volume_dest = ( self.volumes_client.show_volume(volume['id'])['volume']) self.assertEqual(new_type['name'], volume_dest['volume_type']) self.nova_volume_detach(server, attached_volume) @test.idempotent_id('d90e6678-7ce0-4f82-b20d-e311791ef8ff') @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'image') def test_retype_inuse_unencrypted_volumes_to_encrypted(self): new_type = self.create_encrypted_volume_type( 'nova.volume.encryptors.' 'cryptsetup.CryptsetupEncryptor', volume_type='cryptsetup') old_type = self.create_volume_type(name='unencrypted') volume = self.create_volume(volume_type=old_type['name']) server = self.launch_instance() attached_volume = self.nova_volume_attach(server, volume) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'in-use') self.volumes_client.retype_volume( volume['id'], new_type=new_type['id'], migration_policy='on-demand') waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume['id'], 'in-use') volume_dest = ( self.volumes_client.show_volume(volume['id'])['volume']) self.assertEqual(new_type['name'], volume_dest['volume_type']) self.nova_volume_detach(server, attached_volume)

commit_message:
Test live migration of rescused instances

Nova API version 2.32 adds support for live migration of
instances in rescued state.

Change-Id: If7237d3921d7abf1f7d6ecb3c63ef5ecadebf9ac
Depends-On: Ie1fc20fe5e028dd53116d5549814442232ddfe49
Implements: blueprint live-migrate-rescued-instances

commit_message:
Live Migration: Config_drive enable block live migration

This feature will boot the nova instance using config_drive.
So all the metadata will be stored on config_drive_format
specified in nova.conf like iso9660/vfat and there is
disc.config created on hypervisor for the instance deployed
with config_drive.

Just make sure if we want to use the config_drive testcase then
mention that in tempest.conf with config_drive=true

Related bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1246201

Change-Id: I71f0e60f55c420fe9097bb3d6ab4156c50432264

Current clean up relies on a saved_state.json file
and removes all resources that are not in the saved

global-associated resources. This is aligned with
spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595277/

commit_message:
[WIP] Add specifiable clean up function

Current clean up relies on a saved_state.json file
and removes all resources that are not in the saved
state. This patch adds the functionality to use a
purge_list.json file that specifies resources to
delete. The purge_list file contains json formated
global resource ids and running 'tempest cleanup --purge-list'
will delete listed global resources and clean up any
global-associated resources. This is aligned with
spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/595277/

Change-Id: Icb353bedc3f3e39dde9c2179c369de5d37c16b6e

commit_message:
Add tests for basic server operations on AMD SEV compute hosts

Change I6496751fb6657b430ca254818e7f5dd0b1292173 in Nova adds support
for booting guests with hardware-encrypted memory on AMD compute hosts
which have hardware support for SEV (Secure Encrypted Virtualization).

So add some integration tests to check this works.  Obviously the
tests can only be run on AMD compute nodes which support SEV;
therefore a new config option compute-feature-enabled.amd_sev is
introduced which defaults to False.

We (SUSE) hope to add 3rd party CI utilising this at some point.

The tests use the flavor_ref_alt and image_ref_alt configuration
options.

Depends-On: I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d
Change-Id: I6496751fb6657b430ca254818e7f5dd0b1292173

commit_message:
Adding tests for Soft Affinity Policies

The current tests for affinity policies only cover affinity and
anti-affinity.  Starting with Microversion 2.15, soft-affinity and
soft-anti affinity policies were added.  These new tests cover
those policies.

Change-Id: Ib50c07ff424a350a9cc383ab6b05c7649f3e3abd

commit_message:
Add new multiattach test to check connectivity

A test is needed that checks whether an instance can still
read a multiattached volume after it is detached from another
instance.

Additionally, this refactors the attach tests somewhat so that
creating multiple clients is easier. More of these checks will
be added in subsequent check-ins.

Related-Bug: 1752115
Depends-On: Idc5cecffa9129d600c36e332c97f01f1e5ff1f9f

Change-Id: Ica87a3c9ec729c52aca0aff6e241868d24796ede
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/56/548356/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_log import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def _is_volume_connected(self, linux_client): '''Check volume is connected from inside the instance Check that the device is visible and readable from inside the instance. blockdev --rereadpt will attempt to re-read the partition table which will fail if the volume is not connected or attached. Return True if connected, False if not. commit_message:
Use tempest run command directly for full job

This commit makes to use `tempest run` command directly for the full
job. We currently use tempest run command in tox.ini. However, it's
good to use the command directly in case of changing tox.ini to use
the other command such as stestr to run tempest tests.

And also, this patch keeps the original tox call because all regexes
need to be copy to the main.yaml which is too redundant if we want to
run tempest run command for all of the jobs.

Change-Id: Ibc27340d29fbc961704e6ee70b3fb4212414ad60
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/15/602415/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Run Tempest with tox when: tox_envlist != 'full' - name: Run Tempest with tempest run shell: | find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete tempest run --regex '(?!.*\[.*\bslow\b.*\])(^tempest\.api)' {{tempest_test_regex|quote}} {{blacklist_option|default('')}} \ --concurrency={{tempest_concurrency|default(default_concurrency)}} \ --black-regex={{tempest_black_regex|quote}} tempest run --combine --serial --regex '(?!.*\[.*\bslow\b.*\])(^tempest\.scenario)' {{tempest_test_regex|quote}} {{blacklist_option|default('')}} \ --concurrency={{tempest_concurrency|default(default_concurrency)}} \ --black-regex={{tempest_black_regex|quote}} args: chdir: "{{devstack_base_dir}}/tempest" become: true become_user: tempest when: tox_envlist == 'full'

commit_message:
Add testcase for getting hypervisor servers in 2.53

list_servers_on_hypervisor and search_hypervisor are
deprecated in microversion 2.52, and list_hypervisors with
with_servers and hypervisor_hostname_pattern should be used
instead, so this is to add testcase for getting specified
hypervisor and hypervisor servers.

Change-Id: I1ff82e3794facdb67d8308ddd3f3f5e75dcece54

commit_message:
Refactor is_resource_deleted method

This commit refactors is_resource_deleted method in rest_client. In many
cases, is_resource_deleted was overridden with same simple logic. So
this commit just extracts the logic.

Change-Id: I95a521acc9bf6bcaacb9487b95ff4c5fb3b5cd72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/83/467483/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: show_method = show_qos
deleted_lines: from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc def is_resource_deleted(self, qos_id): try: self.show_qos(qos_id) except lib_exc.NotFound: return True return False

commit_message:
Fix test_wait_for_interface_status and detach

This commit fixes a test test_wait_for_interface_{status,detach} in
TestInterfaceWaiters. The test is checking the time for
wait_for_interface_{status,detach} methods. The assumption is that
the start_time and end_time must be same. However, they could be
different in some rare cases such as if a start_time is almost
changing to the next second, the end_time can be the next second[0].

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/722951/

Change-Id: I4ebea774f00852fa6fd147dedfbfa5ebb8c1ff31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/00/573600/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: body = waiters.wait_for_interface_status(self.client, 'server_id', 'port_id', 'ACTIVE') self.assertLessEqual(end_time, (start_time + self.client.build_timeout)) self.assertEqual(self._port_active()['interfaceAttachment'], body) body = waiters.wait_for_interface_detach(self.client, 'server_id', 'port_two') self.assertLessEqual(end_time, (start_time + self.client.build_timeout)) self.assertEqual(self._one_interface()['interfaceAttachments'], body)

commit_message:
Add redirect tests for .htaccess

Change Idec7b2f299ade9b7dcc678ea1daf8daa25f08c44 introduced a redirect
in the documentation to redirect old paths to the new location.

This change defines a test for the redirect.

Change-Id: I7c15918496340bc2e8f2902c39a33343a8de77ce

commit_message:
DNM job to run cross-service designate integration

This is the implementation in CI of the cross-service
testing described during the Sydney workshop:
https://www.openstack.org/summit/sydney-2017/summit-schedule/events/19312

This change is for demonstration purposes and it's not meant
to be merged as it is.

Depends-on: https://github.com/afrittoli/cross_service_tempest_plugins
Depends-on: https://github.com/afrittoli/designate-tempest-plugin
Depends-on: https://github.com/afrittoli/heat-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: I1e7bc9ff2aeb2868caa819289b0d64e35f40cc40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/43/537843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: heat-designate-neutron-nova-tempest-integration parent: devstack-tempest # NOTE(andreaf) For the workshop we ran this job on Pike however in CI we # would like to ensure the integration is working on master branches: ^master$ description: | Integration test to verify designate/neutron/nova integration points i.e. that we can automatically provision / remove DNS records when we provision servers / ports. The test is driven via Heat. required-projects: - openstack/heat - openstack/designate # NOTE(andreaf) Zuul supports using repositories from external providers, # like GitHub in case of OpenStack's Zuul. However before they can be used # repositories must be configured in Zuul's tenant. For the sake of this # demo I'm not going to change Zuul's configuration; plugins are installed # instead directly from github. Using required-projects they could be # installed from a local directory instead. # - github.com/afrittoli/designate-tempest-plugin # - github.com/afrittoli/heat-tempest-plugin # - github.com/afrittoli/cross-service-tempest-plugins vars: # Tempest variables tox_envlist: all tempest_test_regex: | (?x) # Ignore comments and whitespaces # Only run the tests defined in the plugin. ^cross_service_tempest_plugin\.tests.*$ # Devstack variables devstack_services: s-proxy: false s-object: false s-container: false s-account: false horizon: false heat: true designate: true devstack_plugins: heat: git://git.openstack.org/openstack/heat designate: git://git.openstack.org/openstack/designate devstack_localrc: DESIGNATE_BACKEND_DRIVER: bind9 TEMPEST_PLUGINS: > -e git+https://https://github.com/afrittoli/cross_service_tempest_plugins#egg=cross_service_tempest_plugin -e git+https://github.com/afrittoli/designate-tempest-plugin#egg=designate_tempest_plugin -e git+https://github.com/afrittoli/heat-tempest-plugin#egg=heat_tempest_plugin devstack_localconf: post-config: $GLANCE_API_CONF: DEFAULT: default_store: file $NEUTRON_CONF: DEFAULT: dns_domain=ci-domain.org. external_dns_driver=designate designate: url=http://$SERVICE_HOST:9001/v2 admin_auth_url=http://$SERVICE_HOST/identity admin_username=admin admin_password=secretadmin admin_tenant_name=admin allow_reverse_dns_lookup=True ipv4_ptr_zone_prefix_size=24 ipv6_ptr_zone_prefix_size=116 /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE: ml2: extension_drivers: port_security,dns_domain_ports $Q_L3_CONF_FILE: DEFAULT: router_delete_namespaces: True $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE: DEFAULT: dhcp_delete_namespaces: True - job: - heat-designate-neutron-nova-tempest-integration

commit_message:
List plugins after a tempest run

Match what d-g does today for the all-plugin tox env:
https://github.com/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/blob/master/devstack-vm-gate.sh#L878

and extend it by running it after any tempest run.

Change-Id: Ia4d5bf87550228e46007137642776db7bac13fa3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/62/542962/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: List Tempest plugins command: .tox/all-plugin/bin/tempest list-plugins args: chdir: "{{devstack_base_dir}}/tempest" become: true become_user: tempest when: tox_envlist == 'all-plugin'

subject: Ensure that no (s)testr folder exists in zuul_work
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-02-14 16:20:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/a997abb0acc9c8620ef4963ae38a5a59f3a3e99d', 'message': 'Ensure that no (s)testr folder exists in zuul_work

The plugin sanity job uses the tox base job which looks for an
(s)testr folder and tries to produce subunit when not found.
This causes a failure in POST since the folder is found but there
are no tests in it.

Ensure the folders are absent in post, which is run before the tox
and unittest posts.

Change-Id: I99cb5ed4c65ca50968649cb8f8c854cd24e7df0b
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-02-14 18:31:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/51f1bb339cd377a216a9e5c26247191ab821c32b', 'message': 'Ensure that no (s)testr folder exists in zuul_work

The plugin sanity job uses the tox base job which looks for an
(s)testr folder and tries to produce subunit when not found.
This causes a failure in POST since the folder is found but there
are no tests in it.

Ensure the folders are absent in post, which is run before the tox
and unittest posts.

Change-Id: I99cb5ed4c65ca50968649cb8f8c854cd24e7df0b
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-02-14 19:30:38.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/plugin-sanity-check/post.yaml', '.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/fcd71ae511b8d9f562c8b5c7842ffb81272ea668', 'message': 'Ensure that no (s)testr folder exists in zuul_work

The plugin sanity job uses the tox base job which looks for an
(s)testr folder and tries to produce subunit when not found.
This causes a failure in POST since the folder is found but there
are no tests in it.

commit_message:
Ensure that no (s)testr folder exists in zuul_work

The plugin sanity job uses the tox base job which looks for an
(s)testr folder and tries to produce subunit when not found.
This causes a failure in POST since the folder is found but there
are no tests in it.

Ensure the folders are absent in post, which is run before the tox
and unittest posts.

Change-Id: I99cb5ed4c65ca50968649cb8f8c854cd24e7df0b

commit_message:
Read functional creds from clouds.yaml

devstack now writes out a clouds.yaml file which can be consumed to
find the credentials to use for a functional test run. Rather than
having each client write the code for pulling creds out of it
themselves, provide a default method which pulls the credentials out.
The method can still be overridden if the client wants to do something
additional, but there is really no real benefit in being different here.

This should allow us to delete code from several consumers.

Change-Id: Idaaea24795daf74977a133841960287da6fade3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/17/284217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os_client_config self.creds = self._get_creds() def _get_creds(self, cloud='devstack-admin'): """Retrieves credentials to run functional tests Credentials are either read via os-client-config from the environment or from a config file ('clouds.yaml'). Environment variables override those from the config file. devstack produces a clouds.yaml with two named clouds - one named 'devstack' which has user privs and one named 'devstack-admin' which has admin privs. This function will default to getting the 'admin' credentials as that is what current consumers are doing. auth = self._get_cloud_config(cloud=cloud).get_auth_args() if auth: return dict( username=auth['username'], password=auth['password'], tenant_name=auth['project_name'], uri=auth['auth_url']) return None def _get_cloud_config(self, cloud='devstack-admin'): config = os_client_config.OpenStackConfig() try: return config.get_one_cloud(cloud=cloud) except os_client_config.exceptions.OpenStackConfigException: try: return confg.get_one_cloud(cloud='envvars') except os_client_config.exceptions.OpenStackConfigException: return None def _get_clients(self): """Method to initialize CLIClient object. This method can be overloaded in child test classes if there is something additional that the child test wants to accomplish. It should be used to initialize the CLIClient object with the appropriate credentials during the setUp() phase of tests. """ kwargs = self.creds.copy() cli_dir = os.environ.get(self.CLIENT_ENV_KEY, None) if cli_dir: kwargs['cli_dir'] = cli_dir return base.CLIClient(**kwargs)
deleted_lines: def _get_clients(self): """Abstract method to initialize CLIClient object. This method must be overloaded in child test classes. It should be used to initialize the CLIClient object with the appropriate credentials during the setUp() phase of tests. raise NotImplementedError

commit_message:
Add CLI option to tempest account-generator to create networks

This commit adds a new CLI options -n/--create-isolated-networks to
the tempest account generator command which will trigger the creation
of neturon resources to provide isolated networks for each created
user/tenant pair by the utility. Previously the only interface for
doing this was if the tempest config file being used had both neutron
enabled and create_isolated_networks were enabled. This was a terrible
interface for users and is not at all obvious. While the old approach
will still work this commit provides an explicit flag for users to use
so they don't need to worry about getting the config file perfect
before creating users. (which is likely the case since this is utils
is often run pre-config)

Change-Id: Ie50cd43c445180499422e59c2fe60938d27fc37d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/54/301154/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adding temp extra ssh DEBUG

To debug the ssh banner issue, adding an ssh -vvv via subprocess.
This is a temporary fix and should be removed as soon as the
issue is identified and fixed.

The issue does not happen often enough to just recheck on this
patch, so merge temporarily.

Change-Id: If814e88ac484de935bd9af31e44afdbd923b6735

commit_message:
Add an option to include timestamps in JSON

Timestamps are pruned out of any output of the subunit
describe calls script, however it may be useful to have them
in the JSON for postprocessing and plotting.

To avoid changing the default behaviour, adding an option
to activate timestamps.

Change-Id: I3847a4bb3d877aea3000e10468e89ac50abd631b

commit_message:
Make cold_migration test fail when non-multinodes

This commit makes the cold_migration tests fail when 'min_compute_nodes'
has less than 2 nodes. Originally, the tests are skipped at the
condition. However, I think it is kind of misconfiguration. This is a
bit strict, but it is better than loose.

Change-Id: I039a3e4122385ed8f87883c74a6377d0fb5344f2

commit_message:
Create subnet with subnetpool

This commit create subnetpool as part of the dynamic crdential
provisioning process. In addition, the subnet will be created
within that subnetpool. This allows tempest tests to run under
the environment that there is a subnetpool in the tenant network.

In before, dynamic credential will provision a subnet without
subnetpool, which doesn't seems to be the common senario. In the
latest devstack setup, tenant subnets will be created with a
subnetpool. This commit will make the testing environment in
tempest closer to the default devstack environment.

Change-Id: I62c80a4928d7bb075fe229cc6c568d884b4a22ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/40/466440/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix object_storage/test_account_services tests error

This commit fixes errors in object_storage/test_account_services.py.
The containers could be conflicts with some other swift tests in one
account.[1] So, this commit is trying to avoid it with naming
containers.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/626775/
http://status.openstack.org/openstack-health/#/test/tempest.api.object_storage.test_account_services.AccountTest.test_list_containers_with_end_marker?duration=P3M

Change-Id: I9e01554b2fe6089618ef6897812ff84464f3d34e

commit_message:
Fix version clients

Remove redundant _get_base_version_url - use the mechanism
already available in auth.py instead. Also make sure raw
requests are logged properly.

Change-Id: I73798718b9b94727f2fb67b3f59ccff0548d8f5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/69/443969/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time # Version client needs a base URL without any API version api_version = '' version_url = self.base_url start = time.time() self._log_request_start('GET', version_url) # We need to do a raw_request here as no auth is required end = time.time() self._log_request('GET', version_url, resp, secs=(end - start), resp_body=body) resp, body = self.request(version_url, 'GET')
deleted_lines: version_url = self._get_base_version_url() # we need a token for this request resp, body = self.raw_request(version_url, 'GET', {'X-Auth-Token': self.token}) self._error_checker(resp, body)

commit_message:
[WIP] Try to use image image_client

This commit makes some tests use image/image_client not in compute. The
compute proxy apis are already deprecated[1]. So we should use image
service directly.

TODO: Make tests use the client in image service client.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#images-deprecated

Change-Id: Id07a111f26616d98ac38e4303fe46252f44ff25b

create update router description

create and update router description

Change-Id: I360bd9a49199b85b76cdd57f119507e4d4408b5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/83/846283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('2cf6d653-b5b8-4984-a161-91e0db7a5cc9') def test_create_update_router_description(self): """Verify creating and updating router description """ # Create a router with description r_description = data_utils.rand_name('description') router = self.create_router(description=r_description) self.addCleanup(self.delete_router, router) self.assertEqual(router['description'], r_description) # Update the descirption of router and verify if it is updated updated_description = 'updated' + router['description'] router_update = self.routers_client.update_router( router['id'], description=updated_description)['router'] self.assertEqual(router_update['description'], updated_description) router_show = self.routers_client.show_router( router['id'])['router'] self.assertEqual(router_show['description'], updated_description)

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>
Change-Id: I55f899284edfe15c177e5253bb3e278d73955fe9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/42/854742/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Added parameters for advanced configuration of httpd access and error log destinations including piped logging and syslog (see `mod_syslog`). Note that mod_syslog requires Apache2 >= 2.5.0.

commit_message:
Add vGPU inventory check of Resource Providers

Add an inventory check when testing vGPU to confirm inventory has
updated correctly after instance(s) with vGPU resources have been
deleted.

Change-Id: I9a016e7fc81e4b3324dcc25c5f59358b1b2b528a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin refs/changes/69/852469/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_vgpu_inventories_for_deployment(self): """Gathers the vGPU inventories from deployment :return inventories: dict, a dictionary mapping every rp_uuid with its current vGPU inventory """ hostnames = self.list_compute_hosts() inventories = {} for hostname in hostnames: rp_uuid = self._get_rp_uuid_from_hostname(hostname) rp_children = self._get_all_children_of_resource_provider( rp_uuid=rp_uuid) for rp_uuid in rp_children: inventory = self.os_admin.resource_providers_client.\ list_resource_provider_inventories(rp_uuid) if 'VGPU' in [*inventory.get('inventories').keys()]: inventories[rp_uuid] = inventory.get('inventories') return inventories class VGPUSmoke(VGPUTest): start_rp_vgpu_inventory = self._get_vgpu_inventories_for_deployment() # Delete host self._admin_delete_server(server['id']) end_rp_vgpu_inventory = self._get_vgpu_inventories_for_deployment() self.assertEqual(start_rp_vgpu_inventory, end_rp_vgpu_inventory)

options, which is supported by the other modules.

commit_message:
Remove wrong TODO comment

The IPAddr.new().prefix function does not work as intended. This change
removes the TODO comment to use the function because we can't really
replace the current implementation by that built-in feature.

irb(main):001:0> IPAddr.new('ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff::').to_i.to_s(2).count("1")
=> 64
irb(main):002:0> IPAddr.new('ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff::').prefix
=> 128

Change-Id: I07a340e1716f6ab8db718b89bf4535f989df7929
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/68/854468/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove remaining hard-code of username in each manifest

replaces the remaining hard-coded user name by the central definition
in swift::params.

commit_message:
[glance] Make Review-Priority completely sticky

Currently the value persists only if it's the max or min, and only
when there are no code changes or if it's a trivial rebase.

The behavior we'd like is that the assigned priority should persist
across the series of patch sets, even if there are code changes,
because this label indicates the relative importance of getting eyes
on the review, and is not directly involved in the code being approved.

A -1 Review-Priority ("Branch Freeze"), in addition to being sticky,
will continue to block submission of the patch.

Change-Id: Iee323ab80f9a58bf49827c23934560edfad57bf3

added_lines: copyAnyScore = true
deleted_lines: copyAllScoresIfNoCodeChange = true copyAllScoresOnTrivialRebase = true copyMaxScore = true copyMinScore = true

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>

commit_message:
vs_config: Fix broken idempotency with nil/empty value

If the value is nil or empty then the option should NOT exist. This
change fixes the logic to determine whether the option already exists
which is causing broken idempotency.

Closes-Bug: #1987419
Change-Id: I56f85ca35f8e9ee4e5e8d07c714b65f655b1e9ae

commit_message:
Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache

Currently parameter description of the <module>::wsgi::apache classes
are formatted differently in individual modules, and this is making
the maintenance effort quite difficult.

This change updates the description format following the srandard one
we are globally using in our modules to reduce undesired differences
between modules.

Change-Id: I620b9cea87b3bde5777dc8e83e9d8a57440f00b1

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent parameter/resource names of wsgi::apache

The barbican::wsgi::apache class names a few parameters and resources
differently from the other modules. To make its interface and
implementation consistent with the other implementations, this renames
these inconsistent names. The old parameter names are kept but will be
removed in a future release.

Change-Id: I49ca51e4ea7a2404dfdbd0c88ce39339750da4f6

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>
Change-Id: I1491f5b5a895b214e16263c9a2f57838911789be

commit_message:
Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache

Currently parameter description of the <module>::wsgi::apache classes
are formatted differently in individual modules, and this is making
the maintenance effort quite difficult.

This change updates the description format following the srandard one
we are globally using in our modules to reduce undesired differences
between modules.

Change-Id: Ifac421c3a74bf600e8b0e596a8449e5f25cda90b

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>
Change-Id: I16c7a6407d647a25d6093239b30845a212202a5c

commit_message:
Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache

Currently parameter description of the <module>::wsgi::apache classes
are formatted differently in individual modules, and this is making
the maintenance effort quite difficult.

This change updates the description format following the srandard one
we are globally using in our modules to reduce undesired differences
between modules.

Change-Id: Ie874d47e7c9c37da642c2cc5d9c46e385e7cc176

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>
Change-Id: Ifa33b2e84284d8032c4e4f54acb26c30fc285cb5

commit_message:
Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache

Currently parameter description of the <module>::wsgi::apache classes
are formatted differently in individual modules, and this is making
the maintenance effort quite difficult.

This change updates the description format following the srandard one
we are globally using in our modules to reduce undesired differences
between modules.

Change-Id: Ia9334d11a46b1e23532e112665ef6d2c5375eabe

commit_message:
Ensure fencing is correctly handled during update

If overcloud is deployed with fencing enabled, then
we should temporarily disable fencing for the duration of the update.
We are introducing a pre-undercloud update step to disable
it and post-update step to enable it back.

Change-Id: Ie6324fc2c9cdbeac6126e5bdbbce41f23e143be5
(cherry picked from commit 224d964ba745ac89d7fe75840f7e30d884ffc4de)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/56/854756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Check if fencing.yaml file is present stat: path: "{{ working_dir }}/fencing.yaml" register: fencing_file - name: verify the fencing status after update become: true become_user: "{{ (overcloud_ssh_user) | ternary(overcloud_ssh_user, 'heat-admin') }}" delegate_to: "{{ controller_host }}" shell: "sudo pcs property config stonith-enabled | tail -1" register: pcs_out changed_when: false failed_when: false - block: - name: set EnableFencing to true in fencing.yaml replace: path: "{{ working_dir }}/fencing.yaml" regexp: "EnableFencing: false" replace: "EnableFencing: true" - name: enable fencing after running update become: true become_user: "{{ (overcloud_ssh_user) | ternary(overcloud_ssh_user, 'heat-admin') }}" delegate_to: "{{ controller_host }}" shell: "sudo pcs property set stonith-enabled=true" when: pcs_out.stdout.find('false') != -1 and fencing_file.stat.exists

OAuth2.0 Client Credentials Grant Flow Support

The OAuth2.0 Access Token API is added, support to get an OAuth2.0
access token from the keystone identity server with application
credentials.

Change-Id: I4c54649a51534637be831450afc32d3ef8644ee5

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>
Change-Id: Idaddbca1acb1daafbf5381fc2e19f7db4748bbea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-designate refs/changes/27/854727/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
OAuth2.0 Client Credentials Grant Flow Support

The oauth2_token filter has been added for accepting or denying
incoming requests containing OAuth2.0 client credentials access tokens
that are obtained from keystone identity server by users through their
application credentials.

Change-Id: I15e438681749ed2c2666804a9efd8d4712a7b01c

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>
Change-Id: Iaf3e13cbda1cf5fe25f8c4b9fb945f13fa4f30f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-watcher refs/changes/58/854758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Added parameters for advanced configuration of httpd access and error log destinations including piped logging and syslog (see `mod_syslog`). Note that mod_syslog requires Apache2 >= 2.5.0.

available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

commit_message:
unit tests: Use assertListEqual and maxDiff = None

Currently the output is truncated when mock call lists don't match. This
makes it difficult to diagnose the issue. Use assertListEqual and
maxDiff = None to avoid truncating the output.

Change-Id: I93bc6907e926722156739297ac58c327e9743d9d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/97/849097/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Improve comments in networking config files

In networks.yml and inventory group_vars that become part of
kayobe-config, there are a lot of commented out variables for networks
that may or may not exist in a deployment. These are not always that
helpful, and may be actively harmful if the network names in a
deployment are different.

This change removes these variables, and replaces them with a short
explanation of what to add to the section.

Change-Id: I88abe2c515b60e1f1c4c7c073818ff3e47436e64
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/24/850224/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: The content of this section is very deployment-specific, since it # depends on the names and types of networks in the deployment. It should # define the group-specific attributes of networks. The following example shows # a basic configuration for a network called "example": # # example_interface: eth0 # # Global network attributes such as subnet CIDRs are typically configured in # etc/kayobe/networks.yml. # # Further information on the available network attributes is provided in the # network configuration reference in the Kayobe documentation.

commit_message:
Support --kolla-playbook argument

Adds support for specifying a custom playbook when running Kolla Ansible
commands via a '--kolla-playbook' argument.

Change-Id: Ie4bba0f1bdc82657572e0f06a71db1140c0bd3a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/72/847572/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument("-kp", "--kolla-playbook", metavar="PLAYBOOK", help="path to Ansible playbook file") if parsed_args.kolla_playbook: result = utils.is_readable_file(parsed_args.kolla_playbook) if not result["result"]: LOG.error("Kolla Ansible playbook %s is invalid: %s", parsed_args.kolla_playbook, result["message"]) sys.exit(1) if parsed_args.kolla_playbook: cmd += ["--playbook", parsed_args.kolla_playbook]

commit_message:
packages: install iputils for ping

ping is used in haproxy prechecks, but may not be installed on all
systems. This change ensures the package is installed.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib41e8bc4a9d7c5d32df542ad993826c656786952
(cherry picked from commit 9239254201b46051a0f6bdce4ddca7069b7ea6af)

commit_message:
Add support for specifying SNAT source and destination filters

This is useful if forwarded packets need to exit on a different
interface depending on the source or destination IP address or port.

Change-Id: Ifbfbade4baaa1901b08549e52acc725e45379a16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/43/852843/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Adds support for specifying SNAT source and destination filters. This is useful if forwarded packets need to exit on a different interface depending on the source or destination IP address or port.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-01 11:08:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/services/revisions/revision_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/revisions/test_revision_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/4c9cb83d6b46a6425e603194649a61f51a07a307', 'message': 'Bump revision number of objects when description is changed

"Description" attribute belongs to the StandardAttribute class from
which many other classes inherits (like e.g. Network, Port or Subnet).
In case when only description of object is updated, revision number of
the object should be bumped but it wasn't the case for all of the
objects. For example updated description of the Network or Router didn't
bumped its revision_number. It was like that because StandardAttribute
object was the only one which was dirty in the session, and as it is not
member of the HasStandardAttibutes class, it was filtered out.

Now, to fix that problem revision_plugin looks in the session.dirty list
for objects which inherits from HasStandardAttibutes class (as it was
before) but also for StandardAttribute objects to bump revision numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1981817
Closes-Bug: #1865173
Change-Id: I79b40a8ae5d594ed6fc875572663469c8b701202
'}]
commit_message:
Bump revision number of objects when description is changed

"Description" attribute belongs to the StandardAttribute class from
which many other classes inherits (like e.g. Network, Port or Subnet).
In case when only description of object is updated, revision number of
the object should be bumped but it wasn't the case for all of the
objects. For example updated description of the Network or Router didn't
bumped its revision_number. It was like that because StandardAttribute
object was the only one which was dirty in the session, and as it is not
member of the HasStandardAttibutes class, it was filtered out.

Now, to fix that problem revision_plugin looks in the session.dirty list
for objects which inherits from HasStandardAttibutes class (as it was
before) but also for StandardAttribute objects to bump revision numbers.

Closes-Bug: #1981817
Closes-Bug: #1865173
Change-Id: I79b40a8ae5d594ed6fc875572663469c8b701202
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/33/851733/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix installation of OVS/OVN from sources

This patch changes user who runs ovsdb-server and ovn-nortd services
to root.
It also adds installation of the libssl dev package before compilation
of the openvswitch if TLS service is enabled.

Co-Authored-By: Fernando Royo <froyo@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1987832
Change-Id: I83fc9250ae5b7c1686938a0dd25d66b40fc6c6aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/70/854770/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled tls-proxy; then install_package openssl-devel fi if is_service_enabled tls-proxy; then install_package libssl-dev fi

commit_message:
Use standard parameter description format for wsgi::apache

Currently parameter description of the <module>::wsgi::apache classes
are formatted differently in individual modules, and this is making
the maintenance effort quite difficult.

This change updates the description format following the srandard one
we are globally using in our modules to reduce undesired differences
between modules.

Change-Id: I7c8cfb2cf7303fcb280e411276cf121bd1c9a74b

make it voting on wallaby as well.

commit_message:
Document steps to migrate away from Derived Parameters

Change-Id: If235e349115b46a738f7ee79a8fa3f08b6c8b257
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/43/854443/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Migrating Away from Derived Paramters ------------------------------------- If a stack update is run without the -p option (and it was used previously), then any derived parameters will no longer be applied to the overcloud. An example of this is the following process: 1. Deploy an overcloud using `-p plan-environment-derived-params.yaml` to set a `reserved_host_memory_mb` 2. Observe the `reserved_host_memory_mb` in `/etc/nova/nova.conf` 3. Run a stack update without using `-p plan-environment-derived-params.yaml` 4. Observe that the derived `reserved_host_memory_mb` will not be in the `/etc/nova/nova.conf` Thus, to migrate away from using derived parameters, take note of what parameters and values were derived and then create a Heat enviornment file which sets them directly. One way to take note what parameters and values were derived is to look search the output of the `openstack overcloud deploy -p ...` comamnd for the string "derived_parameters". For example:: "derived_parameters": { "ComputeHCIParameters": { "NovaReservedHostMemory": 15360 } }, If the above is not available, then it can be observed directly on the system which was deployed with derived parameters. For example:: [root@compute-hci-2 ~]# podman exec -ti nova_compute /bin/bash bash-5.1$ grep reserved_host_memory_mb /etc/nova/nova.conf #reserved_host_memory_mb=512 reserved_host_memory_mb=15360 bash-5.1$ From there it can be converted from a derived to an standard paramter like this:: parameter_defaults: ComputeHCIParameters: NovaReservedHostMemory: 15360 After the parameter has been set as described above it is no longer necessary to deploy the overcloud with the -p option. The list of available parameters that that derived paramters can set is below. The first two items are controlled by the HCI workflow while the others are from the NFV worklfows. - NovaReservedHostMemory - NovaCPUAllocationRatio - IsolCpusList - KernelArgs - NovaComputeCpuDedicatedSet - NovaComputeCpuSharedSet - NovaReservedHostMemory - NovaVcpuPinSet - OvsDpdkCoreList - OvsDpdkSocketMemory - OvsPmdCoreList

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for Containers API

This patch fixes the Consumers API policies to ensure
that they are only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True

Change-Id: I4e91ca55e3d4030dfdc55d78b92ec3ad3f94bd64
(cherry picked from commit 6e53363f52dcbc32c9b0494379623bbdc55fbba9)
(cherry picked from commit dc49ebaaa27be84c788aeeabb62fd0ca5d968c73)
(cherry picked from commit 1ebdd8f53d36eda6afb88c5fe8143cdc68fc9f40)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/21/854721/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for secret_metadata

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Story: 2010235
Change-Id: I758cd5030e56c6268017a8b133baba7b74db74cb
(cherry picked from commit 328087af6f378c40d6c68436463f7057aecff4ff)
(cherry picked from commit 787b1106edee17039bc7dfa5d333d34392a8ad40)
(cherry picked from commit 8c44a2f955c25f364b7e98599840ebc949e60db4)

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for Orders

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Story: 2010235
Change-Id: I8131987a5b3fc200674b61a52eebb93717d84baa
(cherry picked from commit 0c8efcd2ace537cc1b5df5fda418606054a7e3dc)
(cherry picked from commit 5c7f5ad780c0b59eaa4ab55df34f4eef95f3d86c)
(cherry picked from commit 4271726f6fbb03875c3558e6b21d6bfc3d46ac84)

commit_message:
Add locked_memory extra spec and image property

This change adds a new hw:locked_memory extra spec and hw_locked_memory
image property to contol preventing guest memory from swapping.

This change adds docs and extend the flavor
validators for the new extra spec.
Also add new image property.

Blueprint: libvirt-viommu-device
Change-Id: Id3779594f0078a5045031aded2ed68ee4301abbd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/778347/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get_guest_memory_backing_config_locked(self): extra_specs = { "hw:mlock": "True", } flavor = objects.Flavor(name='m1.small', memory_mb=6, vcpus=28, root_gb=496, ephemeral_gb=8128, swap=33550336, extra_specs=extra_specs) image_meta = objects.ImageMeta.from_dict(self.test_image_meta) drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), True) membacking = drvr._get_guest_memory_backing_config( None, None, flavor, image_meta) self.assertTrue(membacking.locked)

"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2020-03-05 09:02:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache/commit/391a05c1afd0005b914595d3169006c979c8cf43', 'message': "fix _memcache_pool's backward compatibility

Backward compatibility between python-memcached and pymemcache have been
broken by missing a mapping between recognized parameters and given
parameters.

These changes introduce a new mapping between option allowed by
libraries, by example `dead_retry` [1] (python-memcached
option) should be mapped to `dead_timeout` [2] (pymemcache).

This patch map all arguments that need a mapping between libs.

Mapped:
- pickleProtocol => serializer
- pickler => serializer
- unpickler => unserializer
- dead_retry => dead_timeout
- socket_timeout => connection_timeout

Other arguments doesn't exist in pymemcache like `pload`, `pid` etc...
so they will be simply ignored and we will only deprecate them to allow
users to update their clients and drop the unused parameters.

Ignored:
- debug
- pload
- pid
- server_max_key_length
- server_max_value_length
- flush_on_reconnect
- cache_cas
- check_keys

[1] https://github.com/linsomniac/python-memcached/blob/bad41222379102e3f18f6f2f7be3ee608de6fbff/memcache.py#L183
[2] https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/blob/master/pymemcache/client/hash.py#L58

Change-Id: I9e54119cf909a769811abd2bb8af89af0f657b7d
Closes-Bug: #1866008
"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2020-03-05 10:03:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache/commit/b7ccf2757fe4787d44714ba6ea592a47ea23e3fb', 'message': "fix _memcache_pool's backward compatibility

libraries, by example `dead_retry` [1] (python-memcached
option) should be mapped to `dead_timeout` [2] (pymemcache).

This patch map all arguments that need a mapping between libs.

Mapped:
- pickleProtocol => serializer
- pickler => serializer
- unpickler => unserializer
- dead_retry => dead_timeout
- socket_timeout => connection_timeout

Other arguments doesn't exist in pymemcache like `pload`, `pid` etc...
so they will be simply ignored and we will only deprecate them to allow
users to update their clients and drop the unused parameters.

Ignored:
- debug
- pload
- pid
- server_max_key_length
- server_max_value_length
- flush_on_reconnect
- cache_cas
- check_keys

[1] https://github.com/linsomniac/python-memcached/blob/bad41222379102e3f18f6f2f7be3ee608de6fbff/memcache.py#L183
[2] https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/blob/master/pymemcache/client/hash.py#L58

Change-Id: I9e54119cf909a769811abd2bb8af89af0f657b7d
Closes-Bug: #1866008
