"}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2020-03-10 16:27:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache/commit/6cdab111db0d1ca454b52b954079a6a048b14a09', 'message': "[WIP] introduce pymemcache_pool backend

We previously switched from python-memcached to pymemcache [1][2][3],
however these changes introduced issues [4].

By trying to fix them we faced possible side effects on connection
management. Indeed, each library manage connections and dead hosts
in different maner which could be an issue and could possibly introduce
inconsistance between versions on ``memcache_pool`` backend usages.

Indeed, within python-memcached many properties of the client are
public, by example client's servers properties are public
(cf. client's servers ``deaduntil`` property).
On pymemcache dead hosts informations are private and/or protected and tweak
this kind of properties is not something that we want to do to keep client up
on the oslo.cache side like the current ``memcache_pool``.

Also pymemcache reallize tests at each method call on is servers, and if
a server is considered dead then he's automatically removed, this is
managed differently with python-memcached.

We decided to restore the previous behavior by reintroducing
python-memcached and by blacklisting the broken oslo.cache's version [5].

However python-memcached have some weaknesses:
- it's not a actively maintained project:
    * no updates since 2017;
    * many issues opened since 2 years and not addressed/discussed at all.
- it depend on threading and so eventlet on your side.

Move from python-memcached to pymemcache could help us to move away from
eventlet in this library and ensure to us to use an actively maintained
project, so for these reasons it could be interesting to continue our
migration toward a more modern memcached client and try to promote
pymemcache usages.

These changes provides a fixed version (free from the observed bug [4]) of the
pymemcache version previously introduced and reverted.

Instead of abruptly replace python-memcached by pymemcache
these changes prefer to introduce a new experimental backend.
This new backend could be tested more widely before moving it as the default
backend for ``memcache_pool`` backend. It could allow to us a smooth
migration by surrounding non detected side effects.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/634457/
[2] 8a8248d764bbb1db6c0089a58745803c03e38fdb
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710883/1/deliverables/ussuri/oslo.cache.yaml
[4] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1866008
[5] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711427/

Change-Id: I9e54119cf909a769811abd2bb8af89af0f657b7d

Indeed, within python-memcached many properties of the client are
public, by example client's servers properties are public
(cf. client's servers ``deaduntil`` property).
On pymemcache dead hosts informations are private and/or protected and tweak
this kind of properties is not something that we want to do to keep client up
on the oslo.cache side like the current ``memcache_pool``.

Also pymemcache reallize tests at each method call on is servers, and if
a server is considered dead then he's automatically removed, this is
managed differently with python-memcached.

We decided to restore the previous behavior by reintroducing
python-memcached and by blacklisting the broken oslo.cache's version [5].

However python-memcached have some weaknesses:
- it's not a actively maintained project:
    * no updates since 2017;
    * many issues opened since 2 years and not addressed/discussed at all.
- it depend on threading and so eventlet on your side.

Move from python-memcached to pymemcache could help us to move away from
eventlet in this library and ensure to us to use an actively maintained
project, so for these reasons it could be interesting to continue our
migration toward a more modern memcached client and try to promote
pymemcache usages.

These changes provides a fixed version (free from the observed bug [4]) of the
pymemcache version previously introduced and reverted.

Instead of abruptly replace python-memcached by pymemcache
these changes prefer to introduce a new experimental backend.
This new backend could be tested more widely before moving it as the default
backend for ``memcache_pool`` backend. It could allow to us a smooth
migration by surrounding non detected side effects.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/634457/
[2] 8a8248d764bbb1db6c0089a58745803c03e38fdb
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710883/1/deliverables/ussuri/oslo.cache.yaml
[4] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1866008
[5] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711427/

Change-Id: I9e54119cf909a769811abd2bb8af89af0f657b7d

"}, {'number': 33, 'created': '2020-03-13 17:32:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache/commit/40717c028dcc51447411b1216a5cf9e232d9fbee', 'message': "[WIP] introduce pymemcache_pool backend

We previously switched from python-memcached to pymemcache [1][2][3],
however these changes introduced issues [4].

By trying to fix them we faced possible side effects on connection
management. Indeed, each library manage connections and dead hosts
in different maner which could be an issue and could possibly introduce
inconsistance between versions on ``memcache_pool`` backend usages.

Indeed, within python-memcached many properties of the client are
public, by example client's servers properties are public
(cf. client's servers ``deaduntil`` property).
On pymemcache dead hosts informations are private and/or protected and tweak
this kind of properties is not something that we want to do to keep client up
on the oslo.cache side like the current ``memcache_pool``.

Also pymemcache reallize tests at each method call on is servers, and if
a server is considered dead then he's automatically removed, this is
managed differently with python-memcached.

We decided to restore the previous behavior by reintroducing
python-memcached and by blacklisting the broken oslo.cache's version [5].

However python-memcached have some weaknesses:
- it's not a actively maintained project:
    * no updates since 2017;
    * many issues opened since 2 years and not addressed/discussed at all.
- it depend on threading and so eventlet on your side.

Move from python-memcached to pymemcache could help us to move away from
eventlet in this library and ensure to us to use an actively maintained
project, so for these reasons it could be interesting to continue our
migration toward a more modern memcached client and try to promote
pymemcache usages.

These changes provides a fixed version (free from the observed bug [4]) of the
pymemcache version previously introduced and reverted.

Instead of abruptly replace python-memcached by pymemcache
these changes prefer to introduce a new experimental backend.
This new backend could be tested more widely before moving it as the default
backend for ``memcache_pool`` backend. It could allow to us a smooth
migration by surrounding non detected side effects.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/634457/
[2] 8a8248d764bbb1db6c0089a58745803c03e38fdb
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710883/1/deliverables/ussuri/oslo.cache.yaml
[4] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1866008
[5] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711427/

Change-Id: I9e54119cf909a769811abd2bb8af89af0f657b7d

commit_message:
Adding the new pymemcache_pool backend

We previously switched from python-memcached to pymemcache [1][2][3],
however these changes introduced issues [4].

By trying to fix them we faced possible side effects on connection
management. Indeed, each library manage connections and dead hosts
in different maner which could be an issue and could possibly introduce
inconsistance between versions on ``memcache_pool`` backend usages.

Indeed, within python-memcached many properties of the client are
public, by example client's servers properties are public
(cf. client's servers ``deaduntil`` property).
On pymemcache dead hosts informations are private and/or protected and tweak
this kind of properties is not something that we want to do to keep client up
on the oslo.cache side like the current ``memcache_pool``.

Also pymemcache reallize tests at each method call on is servers, and if
a server is considered dead then he's automatically removed, this is
managed differently with python-memcached.

We decided to restore the previous behavior by reintroducing
python-memcached and by blacklisting the broken oslo.cache's version [5].

However python-memcached have some weaknesses:
- it's not a actively maintained project:
    * no updates since 2017;
    * many issues opened since 2 years and not addressed/discussed at all.
- it depend on threading and so eventlet on your side.

Move from python-memcached to pymemcache could help us to move away from
eventlet in this library and ensure to us to use an actively maintained
project, so for these reasons it could be interesting to continue our
migration toward a more modern memcached client and try to promote
pymemcache usages.

These changes provides a fixed version (free from the observed bug [4]) of the
pymemcache version previously introduced and reverted.

Instead of abruptly replace python-memcached by pymemcache
these changes prefer to introduce a new experimental backend.
This new backend could be tested more widely before moving it as the default
backend for ``memcache_pool`` backend. It could allow to us a smooth
migration by surrounding non detected side effects.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/634457/
[2] 8a8248d764bbb1db6c0089a58745803c03e38fdb
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710883/1/deliverables/ussuri/oslo.cache.yaml
[4] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1866008
[5] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711427/

Change-Id: I9e54119cf909a769811abd2bb8af89af0f657b7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.cache refs/changes/20/711220/40 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'dead_retry' in self._arguments: # (hberaud) pymemcache dead_timeout is intialized with an integer # by default [1].The pymemcache documentation ask for a float [2] # but I think we are safe here if we simply pass the dead_retry # directly. # [1] https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/blob/master/pymemcache/client/hash.py#L34 ## noqa # [2] https://github.com/pinterest/pymemcache/blob/master/pymemcache/client/hash.py#L58 ## noqa self._arguments['dead_timeout'] = self._arguments['dead_retry'] del self._arguments['dead_retry']

commit_message:
For evacuation, ignore if task_state is not None

ignore instance task state and continue with vm evacutaion

Closes-Bug: #1978983

commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: fix cinder's namespaces

Add castellan.conf to cinder's config-generator namespaces.

Cinder's key_manager settings were moved to castellan, and cinder
has castellan.config in its list of config-generator namespaces [1].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/commit/7fa996bb665424aaf6018815cb0daff38ed433d6/tools/config/cinder-config-generator.conf#L4

Change-Id: I3395cb30b4e970fae6573faa25ad3ae9d2050c7e
(cherry picked from commit db07f1b5bf2f71ca8527daff2486d40cdc043844)

Allow mulitple GlusterFS backends

This change fixes duplicate resource declarations when multiple
GlusterFS backends are configured.

Closes-Bug: #1987715

vnic_type direct to the ovs mechanism drivers supported
vnic_types. This cause problems when working with ovs and sriovnicswitch
mechanism drivers in that order.  In this case the ovs will bind

This change make ovs mech driver ot bind the direct port only
if user requested --binding-profile '{"capabilities": ["switchdev"]}'
in the direct port if a user don't request this capability the SR-IOV
legacy NIC mode is used.

When enable-sriov-nic-features will be implemented in nova and
libvirt will expose the switchdev capability than nova will be
able to select a host which support SR-IOV nic with switchdev
mode.

commit_message:
ovs mech: bind only if user request switchdev

In I77650be5f04775a72e2bdf694f93988825a84b72 we added
vnic_type direct to the ovs mechanism drivers supported
vnic_types. This cause problems when working with ovs and sriovnicswitch
mechanism drivers in that order.  In this case the ovs will bind
the direct port instead of the sriovnicswitch.

This change make ovs mech driver to bind the direct port only
if user requested --binding-profile '{"capabilities": ["switchdev"]}'
in the direct port if a user don't request this capability the SR-IOV
legacy NIC mode is used.

When enable-sriov-nic-features will be implemented in nova and
libvirt will expose the switchdev capability then nova will be
able to select a host which supports SR-IOV nic with switchdev
mode.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/435954/11/specs/pike/approved/enable-sriov-nic-features.rst
[2] - https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2017-August/msg00583.html

Closes-Bug: #1713590

Change-Id: I0b5f062bcbf02381bdf4f694fc039f9bb17a2db5

commit_message:
Add Apache WSGI logging parameters for pipe/syslog

Add parameters for advanced logging configurations in Apache to
support piped logging and support for syslog (via mod_syslog
available in Apache >= 2.5.0)

Co-Authored-By: Andy Botting <andy@andybotting.com>
Change-Id: I643778c71a683f95a5e91f0904634a0e849ad60d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-manila refs/changes/26/854726/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Added parameters for advanced configuration of httpd access and error log destinations including piped logging and syslog (see `mod_syslog`). Note that mod_syslog requires Apache2 >= 2.5.0.

commit_message:
libvirt: Consolidate create_cow_image and create_image

This commonizes the code in create_cow_image and create_image so that
creating a qcow2 image will use the same code path as any other disk
format.

This is done ahead of adding encryption support to the qemu-img create
command to avoid duplication.

Change-Id: I111cfc8a5eae27b15c6312957255fcf973038ddf

added_lines: # Copyright 2022 Red Hat, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from nova import test from nova.tests import fixtures as nova_fixtures from nova.tests.functional.api import client from nova.tests.functional import fixtures as func_fixtures from nova.tests.functional import integrated_helpers class EvacuateServerWithTaskState( test.TestCase, integrated_helpers.InstanceHelperMixin, ): """Regression test for bug 1978983 If instance task state is powering-off or not None instance should be allowed to evacuate. """ def setUp(self): super().setUp() # Stub out external dependencies. self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.NeutronFixture(self)) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.GlanceFixture(self)) self.useFixture(func_fixtures.PlacementFixture()) self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.HostNameWeigherFixture()) # Start nova controller services. self.start_service('conductor') self.start_service('scheduler') api_fixture = self.useFixture(nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture( api_version='v2.1')) self.api = api_fixture.admin_api self.src = self._start_compute(host='host1') self.dest = self._start_compute(host='host2') def test_evacuate_instance(self): """Evacuating a server """ server = self._create_server(networks=[]) self.api.microversion = 'latest' server = self._wait_for_state_change(server, 'ACTIVE') self.assertEqual('host1', server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) # stop host1 compute service self.src.stop() # poweroff instance self._stop_server(server, wait_for_stop=False) server = self._wait_for_server_parameter( server, {'OS-EXT-STS:task_state': 'powering-off'}) # FIXME(auniyal): As compute service is down in source node # instance is stuck at powering-off, evacuation fails with # msg: Cannot 'evacuate' instance <instance-id> while it is in # task_state powering-off (HTTP 409) ex = self.assertRaises( client.OpenStackApiException, self._evacuate_server, server, expected_host=self.dest.host) self.assertEqual(409, ex.response.status_code)

commit_message:
NVMe-oF: Get system uuid in privsep

Move the _get_system_uuid method from the NVMeOFConnector connector to
os_brick/privsep/nvmeof.py renaming it to get_system_uuid and running it
as privileged.

This allows us to read sys/class/dmi/id/product_uuid file in Python
instead of running a subprocess to execute cat.

It also allows the connector to have one less privsep calls if the file
doesn't exist, because it can execute the dmidecode command directly
without making another request to the privsep daemon.

Change-Id: I8f2edef6fda97af0ff3f92e39c8b24a85b6c3402
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/57/836057/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @os_brick.privileged.default.entrypoint def get_system_uuid(): # RSD requires system_uuid to let Cinder RSD Driver identify # Nova node for later RSD volume attachment. try: with open('/sys/class/dmi/id/product_uuid', 'r') as f: return f.read().strip() except Exception: LOG.debug("Could no read dmi's product_id on sysfs") try: out, err = rootwrap.custom_execute('dmidecode', '-ssystem-uuid') if not out: LOG.warning('dmidecode returned empty system-uuid') except putils.ProcessExecutionError as e: LOG.debug("Unable to locate dmidecode. For Cinder RSD Backend," " please make sure it is installed: %s", e) out = "" return out.strip()

commit_message:
NVMe-oF: read mdstat in Python

The get_md_name uses the contents of mdstat using cat and piping it to
grep and then to awk using a privileged shell, but there's no need to do
that.

Actually the mdstat file has 0444 access, so we can read it in Python
directly instead of having to call the privsep daemon to create the
subprocess with the shell.

This patch changes the current implementation of the method to do the
reading and searching in Python.

Change-Id: Idbba6f9a6d928aa94d2920fc1bf8b6e2a0626a07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/56/836056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: with open('/proc/mdstat', 'r') as f: lines = [line.split(' ')[0] for line in f.read().split('\n') if device_name in line] if lines: return lines[0] except Exception as exc: LOG.debug("[!] Could not find md name for %s in mdstat: %s", device_name, exc)
deleted_lines: get_md_cmd = ( 'cat /proc/mdstat | grep ' + device_name + ' | awk \'{print $1;}\'') cmd = ['bash', '-c', get_md_cmd] LOG.debug("[!] cmd = " + str(cmd)) cmd_output = None try: lines, err = executor._execute( *cmd, run_as_root=True, root_helper=executor._root_helper) for line in lines.split('\n'): cmd_output = line break LOG.debug("[!] cmd_output = " + cmd_output) if err: return None return cmd_output except putils.ProcessExecutionError as ex: LOG.warning("[!] Could not run cmd: %s", str(ex))

commit_message:
Move NFS job to voting

Recent Cinder and Tempest changes broke the NFS CI jobs.

We should ensure the NFS job passes to prevent this
in the future.

Change-Id: Ib96d65783607f36e115b6b80af6967d463090fdc

added_lines: import itertoolsdef block_device_info_get_encrypted_disks(block_device_info): return [ driver_bdm for driver_bdm in itertools.chain( block_device_info['image'], block_device_info['ephemerals'] ) if driver_bdm['encrypted'] ]

subject: Support authentication in Bifrost
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-02 10:45:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/c0653c60abe7d9ec2ee2a3bc758add2b7bb5101b', 'message': 'Support authentication & TLS in Bifrost

* Switch from python-ironic-inspector-client to openstacksdk in
  ironic-inspector-rules. This allows us to use clouds.yaml to provide
  credentials.
* Enable authentication in Bifrost. Passwords are auto-generated by
  Bifrost, and stored files in /root/.config/bifrost/. This change
  depends on a Kolla Ansible patch that ensures that these credentials
  are persisted between recreations of the bifrost container.
* Copy clouds.yaml and (if present) a CA certificate from the Bifrost
  container to the seed host, under the Kayobe Ansible user (stack).
  This allows us to use the credentials to register introspection rules.
* This patch is needed by a Kolla Ansible patch that enables TLS in
  Bifrost, since we need the CA certificate on the host to register
  introspection rules when TLS is enabled.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/851837
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/851838

commit_message:
Support authentication in Bifrost

* Switch from python-ironic-inspector-client to openstacksdk in
  ironic-inspector-rules. This allows us to use clouds.yaml to provide
  credentials.
* Enable authentication in Bifrost. Passwords are auto-generated by
  Bifrost, and stored files in /root/.config/bifrost/. This change
  depends on a Kolla Ansible patch that ensures that these credentials
  are persisted between recreations of the bifrost container.
* Copy clouds.yaml and (if present) a CA certificate from the Bifrost
  container to the seed host, under the Kayobe Ansible user (stack).
  This allows us to use the credentials to register introspection rules.
* This patch is needed by a Kolla Ansible patch that enables TLS in
  Bifrost, since we need the CA certificate on the host to register
  introspection rules when TLS is enabled.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/851837
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/851838

commit_message:
[OVN] Remove session check in ``update_network_postcommit``

Since [1], when a segment is deleted because the network is before,
the segment event handler method ``_handle_segment_change`` does not
call ``_notify_mechanism_driver_for_segment_change`` and thus the
check performed in ``OVNMechanismDriver.update_network_postcommit``
is not needed anymore.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/786373

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1739798
Change-Id: I4bb22a0a0a233609a4d23af55a050356049eb214
(cherry picked from commit 3202a5c19ec01dfd38c4471be21002467bc0a0e5)

subject: Fix Secure RBAC policies for Secrets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-24 13:19:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/cd6ede41edf38a2c2cf6ed9de30ae123a8d884d8', 'message': 'Fix Secure RBAC policies backwards compatibility

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_scope = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Depends-On: I16ed904eeb27ab7110a7e4e56ef7ea89c8c3c2ab
Change-Id: I224c50a8bf9f540f8f643339a4beeaff36ca6509

only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Story: 2010235

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for Secrets

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Story: 2010235

Change-Id: I224c50a8bf9f540f8f643339a4beeaff36ca6509
(cherry picked from commit cd9b0ba9f0b4606193858d3cf05acd413a66ba1e)
(cherry picked from commit d0a3616170c84f5c1ede8b92de460b19a8412721)
(cherry picked from commit 34f1adc0049640adbb3598b29202573159cb4344)

commit_message:
Stein only: Make CI green again

This patch depends on 2 other patches:
* One in neutron-tempest-plugin to make
neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge-stein &
neutron-tempest-plugin-api-stein green.
* And one in devstack to make it possible for the linuxbridge job to
switch off logging service plugin.

- skip grenade, as QA team doesn't support it on older branches
(see [1])

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/grenade/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I62d60bf7419decc35193ce1aa9a652a3c8bbf80d

commit_message:
Move provider_tree RP creation to PciResourceProvider

It is a simple refactor to move the actual RP creation under the scope
of PciResourceProvider.update_provider_tree to remove the assumption the
RPs are always pre-created by the caller in the provider_tree.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I375a1fb013a8e877c159b907484ba16871935879
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/850546/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self, provider_tree: provider_tree.ProviderTree, parent_rp_name: str, if not provider_tree.exists(self.name): provider_tree.new_child(self.name, parent_rp_name) rp.update_provider_tree(provider_tree, self.root_rp_name)
deleted_lines: self, provider_tree: provider_tree.ProviderTree if not provider_tree.exists(rp_name): provider_tree.new_child(rp_name, self.root_rp_name) rp.update_provider_tree(provider_tree)

commit_message:
packages: install iputils for ping

ping is used in haproxy prechecks, but may not be installed on all
systems. This change ensures the package is installed.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ib41e8bc4a9d7c5d32df542ad993826c656786952
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collection-kolla refs/changes/68/854768/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes an issue where ping might not be installed on some systems, causing HAProxy prechecks to fail.

commit_message:
Install cluster-glue package

On a jammy-yoga deployment, the /usr/lib/stonith/plugins/external/
directory doesn't exists which causes an rsync failure when
attempting to copy a plugin to it. The cluster-glue package
is installed to provide the /usr/lib/stonith/plugins/external/
directory.

Closes-Bug: #1987443
Change-Id: I09f8368a0aebd5fd7d1a62f2e319431adb56c371

commit_message:
fix: Fix server_name is null in volumes attachment

Fix server_name is null in volumes attachment when volume
is attached to server(s).

Change-Id: I69132a2de6c1974e3c081b7cfff0f29b126837bc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/skyline-apiserver refs/changes/25/854725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Sometimes, the servers have been soft deleted, but the volumes will # be still displayed on the volume page. If we do not get the recycle # servers, the attachment server name for those volumes which are attached # to these servers will be blank. for server_id in server_ids: "uuid": server_id, "uuid": server_id,
deleted_lines: # Sometimes, the servers have been soft deleted, but the volumes will # be still displayed on the volume page. If we do not get the recycle # servers, the attachment server name for those volumes which are attached # to these servers will be blank. # We should split the server_ids with 100 number. # If we do not do this, the length of url will be too long to do request. for i in range(0, len(server_ids), STEP): "uuid": server_ids[i : i + STEP], "uuid": server_ids[i : i + STEP],

subject: Always run ovsdb-server process as root user
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-23 13:26:20.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/9d3b55bd820c06b2b0f18c1d8742fc80422f4d27', 'message': 'Always run ovsdb-server process as root user

It is needed when ovs is installed from source. If the systemd unit
is created with STACK_USER set as a user to run service it fails to
start ovsdb-server due to permission error later.

Change-Id: I57c5e5c0520e5f46ceb42fa2b8f39751f4ba2857
'}]
commit_message:
Always run ovsdb-server process as root user

It is needed when ovs is installed from source. If the systemd unit
is created with STACK_USER set as a user to run service it fails to
start ovsdb-server due to permission error later.

Change-Id: I57c5e5c0520e5f46ceb42fa2b8f39751f4ba2857
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/90/854190/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _run_process ovsdb-server "$dbcmd" "" "$STACK_GROUP" "root"

commit_message:
Install libssl dev package if tls service is enabled

During preparation to the OVS compilation, if tls service is enabled
libssl dev package should be installed also to compile ovs with support
for the SSL.

Change-Id: Ide9538c09365f65b9fc6394341dc645a2ba42f46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/45/854745/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled tls-proxy; then install_package openssl-devel fi if is_service_enabled tls-proxy; then install_package libssl-dev fi

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: I5ccde650a8a3b8da956b8a28067af05a7a1a673b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pymod2pkg refs/changes/24/851824/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/raw/branch/master/upper-constraints.txt}

commit_message:
Stein: fix failing jobs

* neutron-tempest-plugin-api-stein can be fixed by adding
ADVANCED_INSTANCE_TYPE and ADVANCED_INSTANCE_USER to job definition
* neutron-tempest-plugin-scenario-linuxbridge-stein can be fixed by
disabling logging service plugin.

Change-Id: I808f523eee8bac3529879294d720ab975518d321
Related-Bug: #1986682

added_lines: # Just to see if this solves the linuxbridge job issue #- logging ADVANCED_INSTANCE_TYPE: ds512M ADVANCED_INSTANCE_USER: ubuntu

commit_message:
[Wallaby] Update check jobs

This patch updates the check jobs to make Secure RBAC and FIPS voting
jobs.  It also moves the dogtag job to experimental to stop wasting
resources.  The job won't pass until dogtag support is fixed in master
and the fixes are backported.

Change-Id: I776d43379e7a98afc8ce8384d5321ec6b7989970

commit_message:
Ignore PCI devs with physical_network tag

The first version of the PCI tracking in placement feature will not
handle Neutron based SRIOV devices. So those are now ignored during
placement inventory reporting.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement

commit_message:
[OVN] Remove ACLs with remote SG during deletion of SG

When a security group is removed, the rules having this security
group as remote are removed. But the OVN ACL registers related
to those rules are not removed. This patch catches the security
group deletion precommit event to perform this cleanup.

Closes-Bug: #1983600

Change-Id: I6bb84cb748a2f80f2ff640ceeb3223413f7e92c7
(cherry picked from commit 1957353ef92ec11766a2ce3d29d51afa8d7fdb3e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/59/854559/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: registry.subscribe(self._delete_security_group_precommit, resources.SECURITY_GROUP, events.PRECOMMIT_DELETE) def _delete_security_group_precommit(self, resource, event, trigger, payload): context = n_context.get_admin_context() security_group_id = payload.resource_id for sg_rule in self._plugin.get_security_group_rules( context, filters={'remote_group_id': [security_group_id]}): self._ovn_client.delete_security_group_rule(context, sg_rule)

feat: show volume list in volume snapshot detail

Show the volumes which are created by the snapshot

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/skyline-console refs/changes/38/854738/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import globalSnapshotVolumeStore, { SnapshotVolumeStore, } from 'stores/cinder/snapshot-volume'; if (this.isVolumeSnapshotDetail) { this.store = globalSnapshotVolumeStore; this.downloadStore = new SnapshotVolumeStore(); } else if (this.inDetailPage) { get isVolumeSnapshotDetail() { return this.inDetailPage && this.path.includes('storage/snapshot'); } if (this.isVolumeSnapshotDetail) { return actionConfigs.volumeSnapshotDetailConfig; } if (this.isVolumeSnapshotDetail) { const { child_volumes = [] } = this.props.detail || {}; const volumeIds = child_volumes.map((it) => it.volume_id); const { id, ...rest } = params; return { ...rest, volumeIds, }; }

commit_message:
Reject mixed VF rc and trait config

If two VFs from the same PF are configured by two separate
[pci]device_spec entries then it is possible to define contradicting
resource classes or traits. This patch detects and rejects such
configuration.

blueprint: pci-device-tracking-in-placement
Change-Id: I623ab24940169991a400eba854c9619a11662a91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/36/846436/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.resource_class and rc != self.resource_class: msg = _( "VFs form the same PF cannot be configured with different " "'resource_class' values in [pci]device_spec. We got %(rc)s " "for %(dev)s and %(rc2)s for %(devs)s." ) % { "rc": rc, "dev": dev.address, "rc2": self.resource_class, "devs": ",".join(dev.address for dev in self.children_devs), } raise exception.PlacementPciException(error=msg) if self.traits is not None and self.traits != traits: msg = _( "VFs form the same PF cannot be configured with different set " "of 'traits' in [pci]device_spec. We got %(traits)s for " "%(dev)s and %(traits2)s for %(devs)s." ) % { "traits": ",".join(traits), "dev": dev.address, "traits2": ",".join(self.traits), "devs": ",".join(dev.address for dev in self.children_devs), } raise exception.PlacementPciException(error=msg)

commit_message:
Fix a deprecation warning about threading.Thread

Fix the following deprecation warning.

* DeprecationWarning: setDaemon() is deprecated,
  set the daemon attribute instead

Change-Id: I7af41eddf597e1ac78e8835a5af2e029d65a302a
Closes-Bug: 1987191
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

subject: Fix 'crm node show' parsing to get list of nodes.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-25 16:21:02.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_pcmk.py', 'hooks/pcmk.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-hacluster/commit/a2ed86b295cb445f5f1d1a4eee0127f34d6073a1', 'message': "Fix 'crm node show' parsing to get list of nodes.

The command 'crm node show' is used on jammy to retrieve the list of
nodes defined in a cluster, although this command also includes the
properties set on a node (e.g. standby=off) which breaks the current
logic parsing.

This change uses a regular expresion to filter out all the lines from
the output that don't start with a non-white character (^\S+).

Change-Id: I3e00daa1b877a7faae1370f08b2d9c5bd7795c5f
Closes-Bug: #1987685
Related-Bug: #1972022
(cherry picked from commit 4e53bea0769d6c8c37e1e2a612c191961e738222)

commit_message:
Fix 'crm node show' parsing to get list of nodes.

The command 'crm node show' is used on jammy to retrieve the list of
nodes defined in a cluster, although this command also includes the
properties set on a node (e.g. standby=off) which breaks the current
logic parsing.

This change uses a regular expresion to filter out all the lines from
the output that don't start with a non-white character (^\S+).

Change-Id: I3e00daa1b877a7faae1370f08b2d9c5bd7795c5f
Closes-Bug: #1987685
Related-Bug: #1972022
(cherry picked from commit 4e53bea0769d6c8c37e1e2a612c191961e738222)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-hacluster refs/changes/52/854652/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if re.match(r'^\S+', line): nodes.append(line.split('(')[0])

commit_message:
Drop the use of 'crm node status' on jammy.

The version of crmsh available on jammy doesn't have the 'crm node
status' subcommand available since it was removed[0], this change uses
the command 'crm node attribute' to figure out if the node is in standby
mode when running on ubuntu>=jammy, and 'crm node show' to get the list
of nodes.

[0] https://github.com/ClusterLabs/crmsh/pull/753

Change-Id: Iafb711be220573cb701527ec84de285edd8942cf
Closes-Bug: #1972022
(cherry picked from commit 1347ea00c1627566d5c9ed3efadb098a52d42c23)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-09 13:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_hooks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-hacluster/commit/98af701cb204ec1306714eee5861c83c9cb2ad47', 'message': "Install resource-agents-extra on jammy.

The install hooks rsync a set of scripts and one of the destinations
is /usr/lib/stonith/plugins/external, this directory is created by the
installation of the package cluster-glue which is a pulled as an

commit_message:
Install resource-agents-extra on jammy.

The install hooks rsync a set of scripts and one of the destinations
is /usr/lib/stonith/plugins/external, this directory is created by the
installation of the package cluster-glue which is a pulled as an
indirect dependency of pacemaker, this changed on >=jammy where an
intermediate package named resource-agents was split into
resource-agents-base and resource-agents-extra wher the latter doesn't
get installed and it's the one that depends on cluster-glue.

The specific chain of dependencies are:

focal:
pacemaker -> pacemaker-resource-agents -> resource-agents -> cluster-glue

jammy
pacemaker -> pacemaker-resource-agents -> resource-agents-base

Change-Id: Ia00061bff2ebe16d35d52b256c61243935edabba
Closes-Bug: #1971841
(cherry picked from commit 32ab2d4bda69b7dff695ff0170d3c51cecac0b36)

commit_message:
Update package rules for some packages in the Redhat ecosystems

While using pymod2pkg on Red Hat's Openstack Platform, I discovered that
some package rules are incorrect for RHEL, and Fedora.  This change
updates these packages for the current mapping.

No attempt has been made to address if the packages *may* have had
different names in older Red hat ecosystem releases

Change-Id: Ib8dec98db572b005b6a6c0c9cbd4d7d8f45a3aba

subject: [tox] Update constraints, flake8 settings and default envlist
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-19 16:58:31.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/pymod2pkg/commit/b861f9d3c67dcc0b4d31446ee08f45fe9d953160', 'message': '[tox] Update constraints, flake8 settings and default envlist

In validating the change after this I found that:
1. The pypy tox env defaults to pypy2 which obviously is a problem
2. The constraints URL, while functional, follows an older more complex form
3. The pep8 tox env would descend into .tox which fails as packages
   outside of out control may have pep8 issues
4. I often have a .venv directory which fails for the same reason as
   point 3

This change addresses those issues suck that a `tox` run completes as
expected.

Change-Id: Ia64b5f7b69744ede12604bfd204ae0cbdb6aeea2
'}]
commit_message:
[tox] Update constraints, flake8 settings and default envlist

In validating the change after this I found that:
1. The pypy tox env defaults to pypy2 which obviously is a problem
2. The constraints URL, while functional, follows an older more complex form
3. The pep8 tox env would descend into .tox which fails as packages
   outside of out control may have pep8 issues
4. I often have a .venv directory which fails for the same reason as
   point 3

This change addresses those issues suck that a `tox` run completes as
expected.

Change-Id: Ia64b5f7b69744ede12604bfd204ae0cbdb6aeea2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pymod2pkg refs/changes/32/853832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: envlist = py3,pypy3,pep8 -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/master} [flake8] exclude=.tox,.venv

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-09 11:08:13.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_hacluster_hooks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-hacluster/commit/c579d517c5a0a5c95ff24f874e9445ed25245e10', 'message': 'Catch FileExistsError when creating /etc/corosync dir.

Hooks are expected to be idempotent, if the install hook for whatever
reason needs to be re-run and the /etc/corosync directory already exists,
because for example it was created in a previous run, the exception
FileExistsError will be raised, this change captures the exception and
moves on.

Change-Id: If43a5c95bb59c9cca7f1a975214a9f013ad6f4d6
Closes-Bug: #1971762
(cherry picked from commit 715d31e09f939844bd27f2d4ed8c9207598a5938)

commit_message:
Catch FileExistsError when creating /etc/corosync dir.

Hooks are expected to be idempotent, if the install hook for whatever
reason needs to be re-run and the /etc/corosync directory already exists,
because for example it was created in a previous run, the exception
FileExistsError will be raised, this change captures the exception and
moves on.

Change-Id: If43a5c95bb59c9cca7f1a975214a9f013ad6f4d6
Closes-Bug: #1971762
(cherry picked from commit 715d31e09f939844bd27f2d4ed8c9207598a5938)

added_lines: mkdir.reset_mock() def raise_(): raise FileExistsError() mkdir.side_effect = lambda p, mode: raise_() hooks.install() mkdir.assert_called_once_with('/etc/corosync', mode=0o755)

subject: Fix Secure RBAC policies for secret_metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-26 03:07:08.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/common/policies/secretmeta.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican/commit/8c44a2f955c25f364b7e98599840ebc949e60db4', 'message': 'Fix Secure RBAC policies for secret_metadata

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not

expected.

Story: 2010235
Change-Id: I758cd5030e56c6268017a8b133baba7b74db74cb
(cherry picked from commit 328087af6f378c40d6c68436463f7057aecff4ff)

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for secret_metadata

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Story: 2010235

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for Orders

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Story: 2010235
Change-Id: I8131987a5b3fc200674b61a52eebb93717d84baa
(cherry picked from commit 0c8efcd2ace537cc1b5df5fda418606054a7e3dc)
(cherry picked from commit 5c7f5ad780c0b59eaa4ab55df34f4eef95f3d86c)

commit_message:
Set versioned jobs to set microversion correctly

Prevent 1.1 (secret consumer) tests being run.

Also fixed FIPS jobs by adding nslookup_target and moving to centos 9.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin/+/854614

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for Secrets

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Remove Keystone admin endpoint

It can still be optionally enabled in Kolla Ansible.

Change-Id: I34ec4a2e9505e9b4c1b8306b87fcd7242a0da227

subject: Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-22 21:09:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/494f9f5c1e6ee5305a40a96b861e2ec7e1285217', 'message': 'Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

commit_message:
Allow operator to disable usage of random-fully

In some specific use case, the cloud operator expects the source port
of a packet to stay the same across all masquerading layer up to the
destination host.   With the implementation of the random-fully code,
this behavior was changed as source_port is always rewritten no matter
which type of architecture / network CIDRs is being used in the backend.
This setting allows a user to fallback to the original behavior of the
masquerading process which is to keep the source_port consistent across
all layers.  The initial random-fully fix  prevents packet drops when
duplicate tuples are generated from two different namespace when the
source_ip:source_port goes toward the same destination so enabling this
setting would allow this issue to show again.   Perhaps a right approach
here would be to fix this "racey" situation in the kernel by perhaps
using the mac address as a seed to the tuple ...

Change-Id: Idfe5e51007b9a3eaa48779cd01edbca2f586eee5
Closes-bug: #1987396
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/41/854041/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: config.register_snat_opts(cfg.CONF) return self._random_fully && not cfg.CONF.AGENT.disable_random_fully

commit_message:
Synchronise tox.ini with changes from other branches

In other maintained branches, the blazar installation was removed in [1]
and then restored in [2] to fix an issue with generated docs. This was
not done on stable/yoga, so this change synchronises tox.ini with
these changes made on other branches.

[1] Ic55dba0038a2209e9fb291a604a5c1da57607e1e
[2] I28d06ae31c4cf44d010e0892a094138112b08641

Change-Id: Ibc7c7751dd8769d3eb5c73c3b9a82b383c6d5630
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/33/854633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: skip_install = True -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt

commit_message:
curl: Add retries

Change default 0 retries to 5, that should help for transient
errors (timeouts, HTTP 408, 429, 500, 502, 503 or 504).

Change-Id: Iad3c7270579ffb38299269481ac64d5582abaa22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/98/853398/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --retry 5

commit_message:

commit_message:
fix: Fix empty projects in profile

Fix empty projects in profile when using sso login

Change-Id: I2296cc88f04e3a3eeb2c51d8e83335923e0e5353
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/skyline-apiserver refs/changes/24/854124/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: async def _get_projects(region: str, token: str): auth_url = await utils.get_endpoint( region=region, service="keystone", session=get_system_session(), ) unscope_auth = Token( auth_url=auth_url, token=token, reauthenticate=False, ) session = Session(auth=unscope_auth, verify=False, timeout=constants.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) unscope_client = KeystoneClient( session=session, endpoint=auth_url, interface=CONF.openstack.interface_type, ) project_scope = unscope_client.auth.projects() # we must get the project_scope with enabled project project_scope = [scope for scope in project_scope if scope.enabled] if not project_scope: raise Exception("You are not authorized for any projects or domains.") return project_scope projects = await get_projects( if not projects: projects = await _get_projects( region=profile.region, token=profile.keystone_token ) profile.projects = { i.id: {"name": i.name, "domain_id": i.domain_id} for i in projects } project_scope = await _get_projects( token=token
deleted_lines: profile.projects = await get_projects( auth_url = await utils.get_endpoint( service="keystone", session=get_system_session(), unscope_auth = Token( auth_url=auth_url, token=token, reauthenticate=False, ) session = Session(auth=unscope_auth, verify=False, timeout=constants.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) unscope_client = KeystoneClient( session=session, endpoint=auth_url, interface=CONF.openstack.interface_type, ) project_scope = unscope_client.auth.projects() # we must get the project_scope with enabled project project_scope = [scope for scope in project_scope if scope.enabled] if not project_scope: raise Exception("You are not authorized for any projects or domains.")

fix: floating IP list page removes sorting based on qos policy

Floating IP list page removes sorting based on qos policy, because the api does not support it.

commit_message:
Ship inventory as a part of tripleo_ansible package

By adding inventory as a part of tripleo_ansible
package, it will be available in tripleo-ansible
rpm and can be re-used while consuming standalone roles.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I34f24f6d923f9933021e7383526919b00b9d6b3c

added_lines: share/ansible/tripleo-inventory/ = tripleo_ansible/inventory/*

Fix Secure RBAC policies for Containers API

that they are only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for Orders

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Story: 2010235
Change-Id: I8131987a5b3fc200674b61a52eebb93717d84baa
(cherry picked from commit 0c8efcd2ace537cc1b5df5fda418606054a7e3dc)

commit_message:
Fix Secure RBAC policies for secret_metadata

This patch fixes policy issues for deployments that have not yet opted
into the Secure RBAC defaults by making sure that the new policies are
only evaluated when enforce_new_defaults = True.

This prevents policy side-effects where some users with roles used in
the new policy defaults are able to access APIs that they were not
allowed to access with the legacy deprecated policies.

This patch also deprecates the old policies using DeprecatedRule objects
from olso_policy to ensure that the enforce_new_defaults option works as
expected.

Story: 2010235
Change-Id: I758cd5030e56c6268017a8b133baba7b74db74cb
(cherry picked from commit 328087af6f378c40d6c68436463f7057aecff4ff)
